summary: A RadarOnline.com article from January 2015, based on a purported secret diary, details allegations by a then-17-year-old victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The article describes a 2001 trip to Europe where she was allegedly forced to have sexual encounters with Prince Andrew in London, facilitated by Ghislaine Maxwell. The article includes denials from Prince Andrew and Epstein's attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the master who employed the victim as a 'sex slave' and passed her to his rich and powerful friends, including Prince Andrew. He allegedly organized the 2001 European sex trip.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Allegedly had a sexual encounter with the underage victim in London in 2001, as detailed in her diary. The article notes he has labeled the accusations as 'categorically untrue'.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described as Epstein's 'right-hand woman' who allegedly recruited the victim and facilitated the encounter with Prince Andrew. She accompanied the victim shopping and hosted the event at her London townhouse.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who dismissed the allegations as 'stale rehashed allegations' and stated Epstein was not a party to the civil case where they were made.

persons.name: Virginia Roberts
persons.context: The then-17-year-old author of the secret diary detailing her alleged exploitation by Epstein and sexual encounter with Prince Andrew during a 2001 European trip. The article is based on her writings.

connections.description: Epstein allegedly employed Roberts as an underage 'sex slave' and passed her to his friends for sexual encounters.
Maxwell allegedly recruited Roberts at age 15, acted as her 'madam', and facilitated her sexual encounter with Prince Andrew.
Described as working together, with Maxwell as Epstein's 'right-hand woman', to recruit underage girls and organize sexual encounters for Epstein and his associates.
Alleged sexual encounter between Prince Andrew and the underage Roberts in London in 2001, as detailed in her diary.
Implied social connection through which Epstein allegedly provided underage girls to Prince Andrew for sexual entertainment.
Maxwell hosted Prince Andrew at her London townhouse for the alleged encounter with the victim.
Goldberger is identified as Epstein's attorney, issuing a statement dismissing the allegations.

events.title: European Sex Trip
events.description: A trip to Europe (Paris, Spain, Morocco, England) taken by the victim with Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, during which she was allegedly forced into sexual encounters.

events.title: Alleged Encounter with Prince Andrew
events.description: As detailed in the diary, the victim was prepared by Ghislaine Maxwell, taken to dinner and Club Tramp, and then to Maxwell's townhouse where she allegedly had a sexual encounter with Prince Andrew.

events.title: Allegations Resurface in Court Filing
events.description: The article states the allegations against Prince Andrew resurfaced in a federal court filing in early January 2015.

events.title: RadarOnline Article Publication
events.description: RadarOnline.com publishes a 'world exclusive' article based on the victim's secret diary, detailing allegations against Prince Andrew and Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The article is based on a purported secret diary written by Virginia Roberts, a then-17-year-old alleged victim of Jeffrey Epstein.
The diary details a 2001 European trip during which she was allegedly forced to have a sexual encounter with Prince Andrew in London, facilitated by Ghislaine Maxwell.
Prince Andrew has labeled the accusations as 'categorically untrue'.
Jeffrey Epstein's attorney, Jack Goldberger, dismissed the allegations as 'stale rehashed allegations' and noted Epstein was not a party to the related civil case.
The victim's diary alleges that part of her duties included recruiting other girls for Epstein.
